gurmukhi: so Jt BUm igry rn kI iqh Taur ibKY Aiq suMdr cIny ] XO aupmw aupjI jIX mY rn BUm ko mwnhu BUKn dIny ]840]
transliteration: So Jhat Gire Ran Kitih Thaur Bikhai At(i) Soundar Cheene|| Yaoun Oupmaa Oupjijeeya Mai Ran Bhoom Ko Maanoh Bhookhan Deene||840||
translation: Those who had come, were also killed quickly and at that place the spectacle seemed like the offering of ornaments to the battlefield.840.

gurmukhi: Dn tUkn so irp mwr Gny cl kY soaU nMd bbw pih Awey ] Awvq hI sB pwie lgy Aiq AwnMd so iqh kMT lgwey ]
transliteration: Dhan Tookan So Rip Maar Ghane Chal Kai Sooo Nand Babaa Pah(i) Aae|| Oovat Hisabh Paae Lage At(i) Aanand So Tih Kanth Lagade||
translation: Killing the enemies with the bits of the bow, Krishna came to (his father) Nand; on coming, he touched the feet of Nand, who hugged him to his bosom;

gurmukhi: gy Qy khw pur dyKn ko bcnw aun pY ieh BwNq sunwey ] rYn prI giH soie rhy Aiq hI mn BIqr AwnMd pwey ]841]
transliteration: Ge The Kahaa Pur Dekhan Ko Bachnaa Oun Pai Eh Bhaant Sounaae|| Rain Parigrih Soe Rahe At(i) Himan Bheetar Aanand Paae||841||
translation: Krishna told that they had gone to see the city; in this way, being delighted in their mind, all of them slept as the night fell.841.

gurmukhi: supn ipKw iek kMs nY AqY BXwnk rUp ] Aiq ibAwkul jIX hoie kY BiR`q bulwey BUp ]842]
transliteration: Soupan Pikhaa Ik Kans Nai Atai Bhayaanak Roop|| At(i) Biaakul Jeeya Hoe Kai Bhritt Bulaae Bhoop||842||
translation: On this side, Kansa saw a dreadful dream during the night and greatly agitated, he called all his servants.842.
Speech of Kansa addressed to his servants:

gurmukhi: BiR`q bulwie kY kwjY khI iek Kyln ko rMg BUm bnwvhu ] gopn ko iekTwN rKIXo hmry sB hI dl ko so bulwvhu ]
transliteration: Bhritt Bulaae Kai Raajai Kahiik Khelan Ko Ran Bhoom Banaavoh|| Gopan Ko Ikthaan Rakheeyo Hamre Sabh Hidal Ko So Bulaavoh||
translation: Calling his servants, the king said, â€œA stage be set up for playing keep the gopas together at one place and also call our whole army:

gurmukhi: kwrj SIGR kro su iehY hmry iek pYg n kau iqstwvhu ] Kyl ibKY qum m`ln TwNF kY Awp sjY kis kY kt Awvhu ]843]
transliteration: Kaaraj Sheeghra Daro Su Ihai Hamre Ik Paig Na Kau Tistaavoh|| Khel Bikhai Toum Mallan Thaandh Kai Aap Sajai Kas(i) Kai Kat Aavoh||843||
translation: Do this work very quickly and do not go even one step backward; tell the wrestlers to get ready and come and keep them standing there.843.

gurmukhi: BiR`q sBY niRp kI bqIXw sunkY auTkY soaU kwrj kIno ] TwF kIXo gj paur ibKY su rcXo rMg BUm ko Taur nvIno ]
transliteration: Bhritt Sabhai Nrip Kibateeyaa Soun-kai Outh-kai Sooo Kaaraj Keeno|| Thaadh Keeyo Gad Paur Bikhai Su Rachyo Ran Bhoom Ko Thaur Naveeno||
translation: Listening to the orders of the king, the servants did accordingly, keeping the elephant standing at the gate, a new stage was set up;

gurmukhi: mun jhw irp Gny ipibey ihp Awvq jwih psIny ] AOsI bnwie kO Taur kO igh swn sqy jsu dIny ]844]
transliteration: Mall Jahaa Rip Beer Ghane Pikh(i)e Rip Aavat Jaah(i) Paseeno|| Aisibanaae Kai Thaur Sooo Har(i) Ke Grib Maan Sabhe Jas(u) Deeno||844||
translation: On that stage the mighty warriors were standing, seeing whom, the enemies would even get disheartened; the servants set up such a place that they received all kinds of praise.844.
